resources.string: How many times was your sleep interrupted in the night?
Length of moderate or vigorous intensity aerobic exercise:
Did your exercises include bone and muscle strengthening?
How long did you engage in relaxation techniques?
How many minutes did you engage in any mindfulness techniques?
How many minutes did you engage in meditation today?
How many minutes did you practice imagination or creativity today?
Rate how much you agree with the following statements:
You openly shared ideas and thoughts.
You completed tasks and was organized.
You made effort and time to socialize with others.
You were able to stay calm and relaxed today.
You took time to be thankful and gracious for what you have.
All that is involved in your life today is excellent.
You feel satisfied with my day.
You feel that I accomplished important things today.
You feel today was a success.
Select your percentage of vegetable & fruit intake:
Select your percentage of whole grain food intake:
Select your percentage of protein food intake:
You feel you consumed the least amount of sodium that you could.
You feel you consumed the least amount of free sugar that you could.
You feel you consumed the least amount of saturated fat that you could.
You make water your beverage of choice
Rate the amount of time spent socializing in person or over social media from a low of 1 to a high of 5.
You sought assistance and/or debriefed when needed.
Nothing prevented your ability to share your thoughts.
You engaged in more social media than face-to-face socializing.
Your socializing negatively impacted your health or took away from your life balance.
To achieve a balanced score, sleep for 6–9 hours and reduce potential interruptions.
To achieve a balanced score, practice vigorous aerobic exercise for 10–45 minutes, do bone and muscle strengthening activities, and practice relaxation techniques for 10–45 minutes.
To achieve a balanced score, spend 10–30 minutes in each category.
To achieve a balanced score, do well for each life question.
To achieve a balanced score, eat 50% fruits and vegetables, 25% whole grain foods, 25% protein foods, avoid too much sodium, free sugar, and saturated fat, and make water your beverage of choice.
To achieve a balanced score, speak often, ask for help when needed, share your thoughts, socialize face to face, and avoid negativity.
Please answer all of the questions.
The Acronym for Nurses\' Self Care

SMILES is a self care tool providing a framework that is realistic, applicable, and easily utilized. To support the diversity of the nursing profession. Encouraging a variety of self-enhancing methods to support work/life balance to inspire a continual journey towards a healthy lifestyle.

Stress an inevitable part of nursing, deficits lie regarding the practice of positive stress relieving methods. Despite nurses having knowledge to aspire and teach self –care, it is a subject that is often neglected in the nursing profession.

Sleep deprivation and fatigue reduces cognitive functioning and has health consequences often impairing workplace performance increasing human errors and reduce patient safety. Sleep hygiene practices and prioritizing sleep can assist in encouraging healthy sleep routines.

Physical activity prevents injury, enhances strength, endurance and flexibility. Increasing exercise can reduce chronic diseases, alleviates stress, decreasing anxiety and enhances mental health and encourages self satisfaction. Relaxation techniques are as important as exercise in ensuring a healthy lifestyle.

Creativity, self expression, and art is a health determinant aiding in reducing stress, and provides emotional physical representation. A component to imagination includes practicing mindfulness, positive self-talk, meditation and visualization in supporting of self-healing and in enhancing mental health.

Laughing and positivity are buffers and antidotes towards stressful events and negative emotions. It ensures health by increasing the immune system, relaxes muscles, improves emotional state and assists in coping with stress.

Consuming nutritious foods is a form of self-care it promotes wellbeing and enhances physical strength through meeting needs for vitamins, minerals & macronutrients. Nutrition improves overall health, increases energy, lowering risks for chronic diseases and maintains appropriate weight.

Socializing and debriefing de-escalates situations and de-stresses and builds supports networks. Through discussing emotions aids in learning and coping and self healing skills. Sharing thoughts builds on knowledge and experience assisting in personal and professional growth.
Challenges of lack of self-care causes caregiver burnout, errors in practice, a decrease in the quality of care provided and reduced workplace satisfaction.

This framework will assist in utilizing the importance of life balance, an emphasis on personal enjoyment and on improving overall health. SMILES includes individuality and encourages holism of health including mind, body and spirit.

Implementing the SMILES framework provides encouragement and guidance to create a pattern of behaviour in supporting self care in hopes to reduce caregiver burnout, absenteeism along with enhancing workplace morale, personal health and improvement in workplace and client safety.

Achieving a score of balanced means that you are accomplishing work life balance! This is the score you want.
This score indicates that you are engaging in an activity in excessive amounts.
This score indicates that you are not engaging in an activity enough.
This score indicates that you have a combination of over and under.
This score indicates that you have not inputed any data.

string-array.name: daily_challenge
string-array.item: Go to sleep with time for 6–9 hours of sleep
Do bone and muscle strengthening exercises
Make time to express your creativity
Do activities that makes you laugh
Add fruit and vegetables to your meal
Avoid foods that are high in saturated fat
Make time to speak with people
Ask for help when you need it
